solution_line_template: Per week, one cow produces {liters_per_group} liters / {cows_per_group} cows = <<{liters_per_group}/{cows_per_group}={liters_per_cow_per_week}>>{liters_per_cow_per_week} liters/cow.

The cows produced {total_liters_produced} liters of milk over 5 weeks. So we have {total_liters_produced} liters / {liters_per_cow_per_week} liters/cow = <<{total_liters_produced}/{liters_per_cow_per_week}={intermediate_cow_value}>>{intermediate_cow_value} cows.
Further, we have to divide {intermediate_cow_value} cows / {number_of_weeks} weeks = <<{intermediate_cow_value}/{number_of_weeks}={actual_cows_on_farm}>>{actual_cows_on_farm} cows.
